{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with tiredness, lethargy, low hemoglobin level, and high serum creatinine, indicating anemia and kidney dysfunction. The positive C3 nephritic factor suggests complement activation. The presence of proteinuria and electron dense deposits along the glomerular basement membrane on renal biopsy are consistent with a glomerulonephritis. Among the options, membrano proliferative glomerulonephritis (MPGN) is the most likely cause as it is associated with complement activation, proteinuria, and electron dense deposits.", "answer_choice": "A. Membrano proliferative glomerulonephritis (MPGN)"}
